intro: Jarrilla, commonly known as Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Jarrilla has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, showy blooms during the summer months. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
